titleInfo.title: ‘The Entrance to the Gulf of Persia; and Coast of Arabia from Ras Goberindee to Muscat. Surveyed by Com.r G.B. Brucks, and Lt. S.B. Haines, H.C. Marine, 1828. Engraved by Richard Bateman’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:500 x 720 mm, on sheet 562 x 770 mm

mods.abstract: Imprint:Published by James Horsburgh, Hydrographer to the East India Company.Distinctive Features:Relief shown by hachures. Depth shown by soundings.Nautical chart of the Strait of Hormuz showing the Island of Kishm, Ormuz and Larrack and the eastern coast of the Ras Al Khaimah (Musandam Peninsula) north of Diba Al Fujairah with Jazirat al Maqlab (the Telegraph Island) omitted. Compiled from the surveys carried out by the Bombay Marine’s officers between 1820 and 1829.Includes an annotation on the survey with initials 'G.B.B.' [George Barnes Brucks]. Inscriptions:On recto, partially legible annotation in pencil in the bottom centre of sheet: ‘Alter these latitude’.
